contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=July 2009}} {{Infobox UK place | official_name= Perry | country= England | region= East of England | os_grid_reference= TL148664 | latitude= 52.28 | longitude= -0.32 | post_town= | postcode_area= | postcode_district= | dial_code= | shire_county= [[Cambridgeshire]] |shire_district= [[Huntingdonshire]] |population= |hide_services= Yes }} :''See also: [[Perry (disambiguation)]]'' '''Perry''' is a small [[village]] in [[Cambridgeshire]], [[England]]. It lies on the shore of a [[reservoir (water)|reservoir]], [[Grafham Water]], just a few miles from the market towns of [[St Neots]] and [[Huntingdon]]. Before becoming a parish in its own right the village was divided into West Perry (in the parish of [[Great Staughton]]) and East Perry (in the parish of [[Grafham, Cambridgeshire|Grafham]]). In the village there is a village shop, a [[pub]] called The Wheatsheaf, a watersport activity centre, a restaurant and conference suite. The village also includes [[Littlehey (HM Prison)|HMP Littlehey]], a category C prison built on the site of former [[borstal]] [[Gaynes Hall]]. ==External links== {{Commons category inline|Perry, Cambridgeshire}} [[Category:Villages in Cambridgeshire]] [[Category:Huntingdonshire]] [[Category:Civil parishes in Cambridgeshire]] {{Cambridgeshire-geo-stub}}
